solution_line_template: He walks {initial_walk_distance} meters first then he returns to the house. So it makes {initial_walk_distance} m + {initial_walk_distance} m = <<{initial_walk_distance}+{initial_walk_distance}={round_trip_to_house}>>{round_trip_to_house} m

The city center is {distance_to_city_center} meters away from his house so the total distance is {round_trip_to_house} m + {distance_to_city_center} m = <<{distance_to_city_center}+{round_trip_to_house}={total_distance_walked}>>{total_distance_walked} m
